metadata.Title: Refreezing
metadata.Extended description: Refreezing is a STICS snow-module submodel that estimates the daily amount of liquid water within the snowpack that refreezes when air temperature is below a melt threshold. It applies a degree-day formulation: the refreezing rate equals a temperature index (SWrf) times the difference between the melting threshold (Tmf) and the average temperature (tavg) when tavg < Tmf; otherwise refreezing is zero. Outputs are expressed as mm of liquid water per day.
metadata.Short description: Degree-day refreezing submodel for snow in STICS: Mrf = SWrf × (Tmf − tavg) when tavg < Tmf, else 0.
